page.title: 13DERWENT VALLEY - WILD LIFE
page.content: The only known breeding ground of the rare grass snake is a secret location in the valley. Rare flowers include the Common Helloborine and Marsh Orchid. The alien Hymalayan Balsam dominates the river banks. Butterflies are few in number. Quite common are Large, Small and Green-veined Whites, small copper, common blue, dingy and large skippers, meadow brown, small heath and small tortoiseshell. Migrants also occur. Red Admirals and Painted Ladies are often seen. The Clouded Yellow was seen in 1984. Most local butterflies have declined in numbers; Dark Green, Small Pearl Bordered Fritillaries, Orange Tip, Wall Brown and Peacock. A small colony of Purple Hairstreak is in the valley. Larger moths include the Elephant and the Poplar Hawk.
